comments.body:
an almost identical version of this already exists in test/integration/scheduler_perf... can we limit ourselves to a single copy of these structs in each test area? what is consuming the output of these?

cc @kubernetes/sig-scalability-pr-reviews
@liggitt  thanks for sharing this. I can move the `DataItem` struct to test/integration/util if it makes sense. Waiting for more comments from reviewers.

> what is consuming the output of these?

This file has been merged with https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/59800
According to the corresponding issue https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/58154 the output seems to be consumed with http://perf-dash.k8s.io/#/?jobname=containerd-node-throughput&metriccategoryname=E2E&metricname=PodStartup&Metric=create_to_schedule I guess.

It is nice to get feedback from the author for sure.
/cc @porridge
Hm, it's been ages since I looked at that codebase. I guess perfdash does not really care as long as it can import these structs from *somewhere*, but I'll let its current maintainers speak up.
Curious what the second condition syntax is? Are you checking if there is some non-empty value?
`.Measured` is a flag set which says which metrics are included. We're skipping the items which are omitted. See https://godoc.org/golang.org/x/tools/benchmark/parse#pkg-constants

μs seems to be printed weirdly as a unicode character - https://storage.googleapis.com/kubernetes-jenkins/logs/pull/59800/ci-benchmark-scheduler-master/20180214-131137--3d30881ee7faa2da-17/artifacts/BenchmarkResults_benchmark_2018-02-14T13:12:45Z.txt

Maybe use sth else?

That's because storage.googleapis.com web frontend declares content-type as just `text/plain`, without specifying the encoding. If you download it and open it in an UTF-8-aware editor it will look fine.

But I don't want to do such things to see the results in clear format.

Can you change that to "us" - I think it's commonly used in many places.
